original_title: Change The Jingle In Your Makita Charger Because You Can
original_content:
Lots of things beep these days. Washing machines, microwaves, fridge  even drill battery chargers. If youre on Team Makita, it turns out you can actually change the melody of your chargers beep, thanks to a project from [Real-Time-Kodi].
The hack is for the Makita DR18RC charger, and the implementation of the hack is kind of amusing. [Real-Time-Kodi] starts by cutting the trace to the buzzer inside the charger. Then, an Arduino is installed inside the charger, hooked up to the buzzer itself and the original line that was controlling it. When it detects the charger trying to activate the buzzer, it uses this as a trigger to play its own melody on the charger instead. The Arduino also monitors the LEDs on the charger in order to determine the current charge state, and play the appropriate jingle for the situation.
Its an amusing hack, and one that could certainly confuse the heck out of anyone expecting the regular tones out of their Makita charger. It also shows that the simple ways work, too  there was no need to dump any firmware or decompile any code.
title: 自分のマキタ充電器のメロディを変える方法- アルドゥイーノを使ってハックしよう
body: Makitaの充電器のビープ音を変えることができるハックがあります。充電器内にArduinoを設置し、オリジナルの回路と連携させて新しいメロディを再生します。充電状態に応じて適切な音楽を再生します。簡単に楽しめるハックです。
